Comment: If Black takes the knight with 11. ...dxc3, 12. Bxf7+ will lead to White winning the undefended queen.

If Black captures with the bishop, 14. ...Bxf6, then after 15. Qh5 there is a triple attack on f7, and 15. ...Bxe5 does not work since the bishop is pinned to the queen by the White bishop.
15. Qh5 may also work, but this is a bit more forcing.
The threat for White is 17. Qg6+, followed by Qxh6+, so Black defends...
Unfortunately for Black, though, he is now lost.
And now there is a pretty checkmate to finish things off.
